name: City of Shadows
text:

name: City of Solitude
text: Players can cast spells and activate abilities only during their own turns.

editions.flavor:

—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

editions.flavor:

—Civic Guild maxim

name: Civic Saber
text:

editions.flavor: Those without a guild signet often display a different form of protection.

text: When Civic Wayfinder enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Civilized Scholar
text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card. If a creature card is discarded this way, untap Civilized Scholar, then transform it.

editions.flavor: "Me, angry? Of course not. Thanks to my research, I'm above such petty emotions now."

name: Claim of Erebos
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{1}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 2 life."

editions.flavor: Priests of Erebos give an occasional reminder to mortals who have forgotten their mortality.

name: Clairvoyance
text:
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor:
"As we followed the ice wall, we had the distinct feeling of being watched. Many of the party wanted to turn back."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Clambassadors
text: If Clambassadors damages any player, choose an artifact, creature, or land you control. That player gains control of that artifact, creature, or land.

editions.flavor: "Sorry we shelled your village—here's some gold."

name: Clam-I-Am
text: Whenever you roll a 3 on a six-sided die, you may reroll that die.

editions.flavor:
The Clams down in Clamville
All scootered and skittled—
"The three is no more!"
The Clam fiddler fiddled.

name: Clam Session
text:
When Clam Session comes into play, choose a word. 
During your upkeep, sing at least six words of a song, one of which must be the chosen word, or sacrifice Clam Session. You cannot repeat a song.

editions.flavor: "Duke, Duke, Duke, Duke of Pearl . . . ."

name: Clan Defiance
text:
Choose one or more —
• Clan Defiance deals X damage to target creature with flying.
• Clan Defiance deals X damage to target creature without flying.
• Clan Defiance deals X damage to target player.

name: Clarion Ultimatum
text: Choose five permanents you control. For each of those permanents, you may search your library for a card with the same name as that permanent. Put those cards onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Be worthy of a single blessing, and many more will follow.

name: Clash of Realities
text:
All Spirits have "When this permanent enters the battlefield, you may have it deal 3 damage to target non-Spirit creature."
Non-Spirit creatures have "When this creature enters the battlefield, you may have it deal 3 damage to target Spirit creature."

name: Clash of Wills
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}.

editions.flavor:
"The mind of an Eldrazi is a puzzle that can never be solved. The trick is to make sure a piece goes missing."
—Jace Beleren
Alhammarret rose to his feet, and the full force of his mind hit Jace like a storm front.

text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

name: Cleanse

text:
Destroy target enchantment.

name: Clear a Path

name: Clear Shot

"What worked to bring down angels will do the same for these horrors."
—Rem Karolus, Slayer of Eldrazi

Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)

editions.flavor: Measure once, cut twice.

{1}: Clergy of the Holy Nimbus can't be regenerated this turn. Only any opponent may activate this ability.

editions.flavor: War after war, a healer's enemy is always the same—death itself.

Flying

editions.flavor: Though losses run high among the scouts of the Stone Havens, they never flinch from their duty.

Enchant creature

editions.flavor: There's an experience worse than blindness—it's the certainty that your vision is perfect and the horror that there's no world around you to see.
